RelatedSentence: Despite having four fewer weeks in which to cast ballots , more Georgia voters availed themselves of the opportunity to vote early this year in the party primaries than did four years ago , which the last mid-term election was conducted .

According to numbers released Monday by the Georgia Secretary of State 's Office , early voting was up about 12.6 percent though the state has compressed the voting period to three weeks from the seven weeks that were available to voters in the 2010 midterm primaries .

RelatedSentence: Kemp 's office reported Monday that 239,281 early ballots had been cast as of Friday , with 214,975 of those voted in person .

RelatedSentence: That in-person number this year already exceeds the combined total of 212,487 in 2010 for in-person ( 162,065 ) and mail - in ( 50,422 ) early ballots cast in July 2010 .
In Dougherty County , this year 's numbers are nearly flat with 2010 , though they could exceed 2010 by a small amount .
In 2010 , the county had 1,504 in-person absentee votes and 293 mail - ins for a total of 1,797 .
So far this year , officials have 1,792 early votes , with a breakdown of in-person and mail - in ballots not available Monday afternoon .
About three out of every five early votes cast this year have been by voters who selected a Republican Party primary ballot .

RelatedSentence: It may be that voters simply are n't in tune with elections and do n't know enough about the candidates nearly two months before the actual election day , particularly during a mid-term election that usually has a smaller turnout than the ones in which a decision is to be made on who will occupy the White House for the next four years .
